intro: Copisma viscidulum, commonly known as the sticky copisma, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs that produce a sticky substance, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
